er_text: God, I love Marcha! This is my favorite tapas place in the city. The food here is amazing. Never, ever disappoints! I'm addicted to their "gambas al ajillo"! I lost count of how many times I've come here; either for brunch, HH, or dinner...always on point, always delicious. Everything is consistently good. Also, their happy hour is so underrated! Try it!  Favorite tapas/dishes:-Gambas al ajillo-Pincho de carne-Vieras a la plancha (wow!)-Barcelona Blue Salad-Goat cheese croquettes -Piggyback dates-Patatas bravas-Tostones-Churrasco (plato fuerte)
This place deserves a five for the following reasons,Good foodGreat serviceGreat drinksStaff is super friendly Good hygieneGood music Overall experience deserves a five.

A really cute spot with a lot of culture!Came and ordered arroz con pollo, but the rice was not fully cooked.My best friend ordered the steak and it had such good flavor! Her rice as well was not fully cooked.Suggestion: If you want rice don't come here, and as to the restaurant you have such good flavor and such a beautiful display, but take your time making rice it is the key essential to most plates. Dont't think we would be coming back.
Drinks and Paella! The margaritas were great, I had the. Passion fruit margarita and it was great! The Paella Con Langosta was so amazing. Definitely coming back!

Went here for a Bumble date because we decided to do a brunch. I've been to the One in Washington Heights and noticed this one was close to my house! I figured it'd be a cool spot to go since they don't play super loud music during brunch and you can actually talk to people at your table lol. Super casual and relaxed. I've only had brunch food there and it's always been good. One thing I noticed is that the plates at this location are a few dollars more expensive then the other location, I guess because it's in the city?? Idk, whatever the reason is they should keep the prices the same at both locations. Always go for the unlimited mimosa deal ($13), they have so many different flavors. Trust me, I've had them all lol. Solid chill brunch place!

Yikes! The $13 bottomless brunch is a joke! Basically, there are three brunch cocktail options to choose from: Mimosa, Sangria, and Bloody Mary. Most people will order a brunch entree ($10-$20) and the $13 90-minute bottomless brunch cocktail, which is a great deal...if there was actual alcohol in the cocktails. Our waitress gave us a pitcher of Mimosa and you could see/taste that there was very little sparkling wine in the Mimosa.We had looked over at the bar and noticed the same waitress pouring a pitcher of Mimosa for another table and basically filled the entire pitcher with orange juice and "topped" it off with a little sparkling wine. The ratio of orange juice to alcohol was completely ridiculous. One of our other friends ordered a red sangria and the taste of the sangria was also "off." I understand that the business has to make money, but people come to bottomless brunch to have a good time...not to get diabetes and stay sober. The food wasn't good either. Our table ordered the steak and eggs and a calamari. I've never seen fried calamari cut into such small pieces and it was super chewy. As for the steak and eggs, the sunny-side eggs were burnt on the sides. Overall, I wouldn't recommend coming here. Not only is the location awful (about a 15 minute walk to the closest train station), but also the food and bottomless brunch special is a total hack!

I've come here several times but as of lately the food has just gotten better and better. Their Happy Hour isn't bad. They have $6 Margaritas which I love and they come in all flavors. My fave is the peach. Wendy the bartender is pretty cool. The food here is amazing. The churrasco is def a must. You wont regret it. I will def be coming back real soon. Its a nice place to unwind after a  day. Came back on 8/28/2018, Jairo the owner, is so genuinely cool and conversations with him are awesome! Hubs and I hung out by the bar after what happened to be the busiest day of our lives. It was hot and muggy and we both needed a cool refreshing drink. Marcha did it for us and we were not disappointed. I really recommend everyone to come here for after work drinks. The food is amazing. I ordered my usual Churrasco and Hubs had the Pollo Criollo. Holy Moly....Yikes. It was so so good. Cant wait to go back. We conversed with great ppl at the bar and discovered they now have a DJ with different music genres on Sat night. We will def be trying that out. Thanks Jairo, Thanks Marcha! You Rock!!!

Salmon, amazing. Extremely flavorful. Salmon cooked well, not over or under cooked. Calamari, amazing -  Fried with sweet glaze. Service, amazing. Funny waitstaff. Not too long or short of a wait for food. Red Sangria, pretty good.
My favorite neighborhood spot...tapas are amazing (gambas al ajillo my fav) the service is great.I highly recommend Marcha Cocina East Village!!!

One of my favorite New York spots! I find in general that new york food can veer far into the pretentious. This place is not pretentious. It serves solid tapas, fabulous and cheap drinks, and has some of the best service ever. If you want to sit and drink and eat for 3 hours, the bartenders/waiters here will let you and smile the whole time. This is my go to spot when we have people visiting from out of town.
Love this place!! Food is always so good and service is great! This has to be one of my favorite places to eat at. Brunch/happy hour drinks are also delicious!

My friends and I came here for a friend's birthday. There were 9 of us who came for brunch. Most of us did the bubbly brunch option. I enjoyed having the flavored mimosas. They were delicious. We got some appetizers - calamari, dates, and shrimp with the bread. We enjoyed them all. Everyone had a great time. I'd return perhaps for dinner next time.

Very upset. Came from Pennsylvania here to try the paella! Did not eat anything all day in hype to come try this dish. When I arrived it was time to order appetizers, guess what this will be the beginning to this review..May I have some Calamri? - sorry we ran outNext question?Can I order the Paella?- yes..Ten minutes later the server comes out, sorry we don't have any lobster no more. There was nothing the place did to even show their apologies other than a sorry. The place is a small location located on the lower east side but for their signature dishes to be sold out at 6:45pm is uncalled for. I hope management can fix this issue.However end of the day, the paella was still horrible! Tasted like complete metal. Was able to try someone else plate :)Happy Easter and Beware!

Chicken Sandwich.The chicken was made to perfection of my liking. The fries were an awesome compliment.Drinks were good.Wish it were in a more accessible location. But at least I'll get a good work out before I tear that joint up.Food was great. The people i was with seemed to enjoy their meals as well which looked really good even though I don't eat Steak and eggs.Chicken sandwich X Fries z -enough saidNote: if the Spurs game is on TV you will always get a 5."Spurs All day! Nothing else and nobody else, unless it's a delicious chicken sandwich with no rib meat."

A touch of south beach in the East Village? I think so. A fun place to come check out in the area. I've come here for brunch and a night out with a friend. Great tasting drinks and wonderful service. I love the food I've had the pincho platter and some other tapas. You will love the presentation here! There's culture to this place, and love the other location as well in Washington Heights!

I went to Marcha last night for a few drinks with friends and family, and I absolutely had the most wonderful time. Not only did they have a few specialty/craft beers on tap, ALL of the drinks were reasonably priced. fantastically priced even. I am from the East Village, and I don't think I've ever spent so little money, and gotten so many drinks. I would definitely go back again for more fun, and maybe try some food next time!

4.5 stars. So close to 5, but not quite to the level as other tapas joints I've given perfect marks to. Still, Marcha Cocina is a fantastic dinner option if you're willing to venture all the way to Avenue C. Ave C (and Alphabet City in general) actually happens to be one of my very favorite places to spend time. The only issue is convincing others that's it's a good use of *their* time. I think I need more "down for whatever" friends. Even better, a whole group of 'em. Marcha Cocina has a fun, social vibe with enough tables to accommodate large parties. Not to mention, the food is pretty affordable as far as tapas restaurants go. Our tab came in at around $80 and we shared five plates and one cocktail each. Came to Marcha Cocina at around 8pm on a Saturday night. The place is a decent size and very high energy (aka loud). We didn't have a reservation but managed to get a table in about three minutes. Like most venues on Ave C, Marcha Cocina would be packed if its was more centrally-located. It always astounds me that people miss out on all of the wonderful things over here simply because it's a bit of a trek. But I benefit from everyone else's laziness, so I shouldn't complain. Anyway, if you are planning to come here with a larger group, though, better to make a reservation. They've got nice, long tables in back but all were taken when we were there.You could easily come to Marcha Cocina for drinks and leave it at that. The cocktail menu is all kinds of yummy and tropical. They're most famous for their Coconut Pineapple Mojitos here, which are as good as advertised. I'm not totally sure how I only had just one. A fabulous summer drink and clearly dangerous. The party of 12 across the way from us clearly was taking advantage of them. If rum isn't your thing, they have plenty of other options, too. I will say though that rum is typically *not* my thing, so this is worth a shot either way. I'm guessing the beverages have something to do with the party atmosphere here. Speaking of, despite the excessive volume, I liked the energy here. Most tapas places I've been to have more of an intimate vibe--or at least more refined/sophisticated as far as atmosphere goes. Marcha Cocina brought me back to my summer in Spain, which is still one of the best trips I've ever taken. So if you can put up with the noise (drinks help!), it's worth it. Food-wise, Marcha Cocina has most of the good classics and some unique dishes as well. A whole section of croquetas (yes please), a bunch of seafood and more chorizo than you could ever want. So I'm sad to say that the friend I was dining with has recently gone pescatarian. It didn't affect our experience too much, though. Most of what we ordered was meat-free and the one dish that featured ham was easily fixable so no harm done. Our eats, below: Gambas al Ajillo (Sauteed shrimp, olive oil, garlic and pepper flakes): A-A traditional dish at any Spanish venue. They tend to come highly recommend no matter where you go, probably because the kitchen works extra hard to ensure that they're up to snuff. These were yummy, but not necessarily better than any other shrimp dishes I've tried. I've had a few Gambas preparations that were fantastic, but most are just average or good in my book. I'm probably missing something. In any case, the flavors were light/simple, served as it should be.Patatas Bravas (potatoes w/ brava aioli): A-Another dish they push here. Again, nothing wildly impressing but I enjoyed them a lot. The reason I went with an A- as opposed to an A was because really, they were just potatoes with aioli slathered all over (see picture). But again, a dish like this doesn't get tampered with much on tapas menus. Definitely a crowd pleaser, and the aioli was fantastic.Hongos Croquette (Mixed wild mushrooms, thyme, rosemary and truffle trumpet aioli): A+Oh man, these were it. I mean just look at the ingredients--hard to mess these up. Croquetas done right are serious flavor bombs, and these, as I said, were "it". Mushrooms with great seasoning and herbal flavors coming through due to the thyme/rosemary and then truffle aioli, well, let's just say that those two words juxtaposed is a potent thing.Cangrejo Coca (Flatbread w/ crab meat, goat cheese, Manchego, cilantro, jalapeno, onions): A-I don't typically see flatbreads on tapas menus so this was a nice option. The jalapeno seemed a bit discordant, as did pairing goat cheese with crab, but overall still yummy. Cheese is welcome on most flatbreads so can't fault them there.Vieiras a la Plancha (Seared scallops, spinach, caramelized onions, crispy Serrano ham and Manchego cheese sauce): AGetting this sans ham made a slight difference but I still loved the dish overall. I go hot and cold with scallops so it was a pleasant surprise that I enjoyed these so much. Cooked beautifully, sweet/earthy/rich accompaniments. Service was an A+. Awesome waiter and patient during our long stint of scouring the menu.

Went for brunch and it was gross. Ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it was cold. I think the reason this has great reviews is because of the unlimited alcohol. Maybe when you're drinking, the food doesn't taste that bad?

Came here for brunch, but wasn't very impressed. Their unlimited drinks during brunch is a really good deal, but the french toast I had fell below my expectations; it was really mushy. In addition, they gave me a glass with lipstick stains on it! Then, my next glass came with a tiny bug inside. I just fished it out because I felt that exchanging two glasses would have been too fussy. Might come back to try their tapas though.
Good prices for the food quality and great service. Really appreciated the complimentary check in shots. We had so much fun!

Why isn't this place more crowded???The tapas are delicious, the drinks have alcohol and taste great and aren't expensive at all. I love the shrimp gambas and the mushrooms but everything we ordered was really good. Service was speedy and very attentive. I have eaten all over the east village, why isn't this place more crowded?????? I label this a hidden gem and hope that my review doesn't make long lines for my next visit here!

I  have waited 1 and a half hour for my delivery. Did not arrive Restaurant is not answering phone and I have no dinner. How does a restaurant take an order and then not deliver or answer.....Never again

AMAZING TAPAS. Our table ordered every single signature dish on the menu with two pitchers of sangria and each item was uniquely flavorful. My favorite was the piggyback dates - never thought I'd appreciate bacon with fruit and nuts.Restaurant is on the smaller side, but the ambiance is very warm, friendly, and casual. Incredibly quick service as well. Our waitress even took the free donkey sauce shot with the table!Overall, love this place.

Food is great, service is great and the ambiance is perfect. They have a great happy hour selection. The bartender knows her stuff she made excellent drinks and Alan was very accommodating to us. Ishlam was great to us seated us right away and took our orders.
Love this place. Has a cozy vibe, good music and great food. What more can you ask for?

I really have nothing bad to say about this place. Went here for happy hour with a friend. Happy hour is until 8p which is everything. The vibe is chill lowkey, wasn't too many ppl in here, their loss lol. Service was great. Our waitress was fast bringing the drinks and attentive. Drinks were good also, I had a margarita for 6 bucks. The food was delicious. We shard like 4 or 5 tapas. We had this sizzling shrimp in some kind of garlic sauce. The clams were amazing. We also did a flat bread that was great. Definitely plan on coming back to this place
The traditional tapas was delicious and fresh. The drinks were reasonable priced and the service was fantastic. We will be back soon!

This restaurant is a mirage. I'm 100% sure the next time i'm on Avenue C, it will not exist.The drink specials here are ridiculous, and they're amazing. Eleventy-billion types of mojitos and margaritas, with exotic flavors, hand crafted and delivered with smiling service and charming flair. 5-7$. I can't got those prices in Cleveland.The food was exceptional, and great for sharing. Lots of vegetarian options, but the food was rich and flavorful, and didn't feature a single dud.Small spot, but chic and contemporary. Good music. Will certainly be back.

Amazing mojitos and amazing service; plus a free shot after checking in with Yelp. I didn't have any food here but I'm sure it's just as good considering I've already dined at their Washington heights location. Update 12/04/16 After coming here on numerous occasions I love their service and their food, their appetizers and entrees are amazing. I've been trying everything on the menu as I come and I have no complaints!

I can't find enough superlatives to describe this place. Every single dish we tried was beyond amazing. The dates with bacon something I would never even think about ordering was amazing. Calamari was on point. The steak was amazing. Our little one loved the brunch special said it was the best French toast he's had. Next time I'm in the city this will be my place to go for breakfast lunch and dinner.

Incredible! The tapas are delicious (and I highly recommend the scallops). The service is attentive. The food delivers quickly. Happy Hour is available for several hours - namely 3 - 8 PM everyday. For people who choose to check in to Marcha, your table gets a free Donkey Sauce shot. What is Donkey Sauce? You need to try to find out. ;)

Decent spot for food, REALLY good drinks specials for happy hour (daily until 8pm)$5-$7 margaritas, flavored mojitos (the coconut mojito is as good as it sounds), delicious red and white sangrias, and more until 5pmService is very friendly, and the food is good, averaging about $10 a plate (tapas)After trying a bunch of things on the menu, I give my recommendation for:Flatbreads Bacon Wrapped DatesCroquettesGambas al Ajillo (garlic shrimp) - not for the shrimp, but for the sauce and bread it comes with. They seriously need to offer the sauce and bread without the shrimp!

Love love love this place! The drinks are amazing, food is to die for, and the atmosphere is lovely. Here they don't treat you like "just a customer" they treat you like family. I hosted a surprise dinner party for my mom's 50th birthday, for about 12 guests. The staff here accommodated my every need, let me come in early to decorate, kept the cake in the back for my guests and best of all my guests and my mother absolutely loved the place. We loved it so much we decided to spend New Year's Eve at Marcha and we couldn't have chosen a better place to start off 2017. All in all...... great staff, delicious food, amazing drinks and an enjoyable ambience.

So my friend works as a manager in the supermarket up the block from here. She is a regular Joe up in here. Me ? Im still finding myself   Umm I ordered a chicken with rice and it was okay. The music is okay. This is not like one of those restaurants owned by the kind of Dominicans where after you eat it gets lit. Or at least not the few times I have been here. The drinks are okay you know a drink is a drink is a drink ‍ my first time was an okay experience. You sit you eat you talk shit then you leave. The second time I went here my friend same Joe celebrated her moms bday this time i did not eat but I had the tostones with this garlic thing they make there .... see now thats a winner but it still isn't enough food to get me saying like Im coming back for sure. I guess when i go out to eat i want the food to taste sooo good i tell myself like I'm coming back one day ‍... its small inside and the staff seems kind. Its close to st.marks and a lot of shopping places on union square ‍ give it a try .

Just found this spot in my neighborhood and popped in on a sunny afternoon. The bartender (and server) were lovely, knowledgeable, friendly and gave me great recommendations. I had the tortilla Espanola, croquettes, and a cocktail. Delicious. Large portion sizes and didn't break the bank. I'm coming back for brunch soon!

Just treated myself to the best brunch ever .... after I night of drinking I knew exactly what I wanted to eat this morning eggs benedict from Marcha!!! They never disappoint... just what a needed with a cup of coffee ...  great service as usually...  Marcha is officially my home away from home !!!!
Great food. Good drinks. Brunch deals are solid.
Tasty food, great prices! We came here looking for s quick snack and a quick drink. Great service, very accommodating.

You won't find these croquettes nor chorizo on the beaten path. (Our city's rents and preconceptions prohibit it.) I used to say the West Coast can't do bagels while lower Manhattan struggles with the simplest of Mexican cuisine. I am proven ignorant.

It is a MUST that I speak in regards to this restaurant....  I went to brunch last Sunday with a few of my girlfriends to celebrate a friend's birthday.  It was like a breath of fresh air to experience that type of brunch. It was not empty nor super crowded,  it was very chill where you can hear your conversations with your friend and also enjoy the music ( idk about anyone else, but I enjoy a nice sophisticated brunch rather then going to a brunch where it's pretty much a club scene on a Sunday morning) .  The quality of service was superb; wouldn't you love to go to a place where the server knows what he is talking about? YES? This is the place!  I decided to go with the Egg Benedict (recommended by the server) with ham, and my drink for the day was Passion fruit Mimosa. The food is to die for, as an appetizer I had meatballs with bread on the side ( I posted a picture up), OMG that was heaven!  My friend order the French toast and she was bragging of how good they were that I had to try it... she was not lying, the French toast was AMAZING.  Ok, so I tried the meatballs, I tried the egg Benedict and I tried the French toast, good thing I am skinny lol.My drink was the passion fruit mimosa, but I wanted to also try the mango mojito.  Mojitos to me are tricky; I do not think everyone knows how to make a good mojito, but this place new the science behind it.  It was the perfect measurements because it was so good to have!!My overall experience was very congenial, I loved the environment and the friendly staff and most of all the food and drinks are to die for. I will definitely be coming back again and ordering those amazing meatballs, It is so worth the travel!Thank You for making that a great experience!
Expectacular service , food was awesome great bartender good drinks excellent atmosphere

Went here on a date and the food and atmosphere was great! Small place but didn't feel claustrophobic. The croquetas and flatbreads were tasty and not too pricey. They have this thing where if you take a photo in their bathroom mirror and tag them in your post/story you can get a free shot. It was just a margarita shot but it was cool that they had that.

My friend, Amanda, and I were desperately seeking shelter to utilize Tinder/gossip. Marcha was the PERFECT spot. Amazing staff, fantastic tapas, and tasty margaritas. Not to mention the complimentary donkey shot! MUY BIEN! We'll be back.

I'm a huge foodie and very picky when it comes to great food, great service, and a nice ambiance. This place had it all down pact. The owner, Alan, came over to my table and was so nice! Everything we ordered was great....from the appetizers to the main courses! Calamari isn't great everywhere and they mastered it! Vegetarian / pescatarian options too! Quick and attentive servers (Pamela was sweet! No complaints!) totally recommend this place!
Food is excellent, I recommend this spot, drinks are great as well, atmosphere is good. Definitely a good place for brunch.
Great place!..... food and drinks are great..... service is even better..... Best place on avenue C

Good food and service. However, the restaurant had loud music on with very very noisy customers and a terrible way of trapping and amplifying the noise. It got so very noisy that we basically just ate and ran. If you fancy a romantic dinner or want a proper conversation, this might not be the place for you.
Amazing experience, 10/10 would recommend. Amazing servers, great drinks and food. Overall unbelievable brunch.

I really feel like I didn't go to the same place as the rest of the ppl on Yelp!This is really the worse "tapas" place I've ever been to. The food was basic and awful. It didn't even taste like Spanish food. Maybe the highlight here is happy hour and not for couples dinner like we did. One star for our server and one star for music.
It's a must go !!! I love the food, the drinks and specially ambiance. The mojitos are amazing but the peach margarita is my favorite. The cheese croquettes and Churrasco !!! OMG amazing !!
New favorite neighborhood spot! The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The drinks were amazing and the food was spot on!!
We were on vacation in NY city and came across this restaurant. Is amazing. We had a great time. Food was excellent and staff was great. The food was very inexpensive and tasted amazing.

Amazing. I grew up in NYC and the fact that I can discover new gems like this is amazing! The food was fantastic and the drinks were delightful.Perfect day in NYC for people watching while brunching at Marcha! Perfecto!!

The eggs Benedict with prosciutto were divine. For $13 bucks during brunch on weekends you get unlimited mimosas, sangria or bloody Mary's with your order for 90 minutes.  My boyfriend had the omelet with chorizo, peppers and spinach he loved it.

Found this place on Yelp, 5 stars no doubt. Had the bacon wrapped dates, mushroom flatbread, and meatballs. All were amazing, bacon wrapped dates were out of this world. I would recommend just getting like 9 orders of bacon wrapped dates. Anyway, our server was Allan, he was amazing. 5 star service. It was my girlfriends bday, I called ahead to ask if we could have a bottle of champagne waiting for us at the table, and it was. 5 stars all around especially bacon dates and Allan.
Great food and drinks. Definitely coming back. The chorizo is excellent. Great place to bring friends for brunch/dinner.

MARCHA avenue C:FORK on the LEFT - KNIFE in the BACKsaccharine sweet staffers at this 'easygoing alphabet city pub' TURN on a DIME and BARE FANGs when REGULARS inadvertently overstep that invisible  post-HappyHour boundary, daring to rub shoulders w/ the coveted DOUCHE-bRO-tERRRAZZi...PRICES SPIKE - erstwhile hot APPETIZERS, now cold, grow SKIN and what seems to be hair.don't even look at that check - everything's DOUBLE.OR MAYBE they DON'T LIKE QUEERS, especially on a FRIDAY NIGHT?just wondering...food was always B- ; didn't notice 'til tonight, when we were treated like lepers.I hope no leper was insulted by this news post.AVOID####

This place is amazing! I had started following them on instagram and always wanted to try it. The happy hour specials are awesome. Plenty to chose from and it is until 8pm. Can't beat that in the city. The food spectacular - def try the Gambas Al Ajillo, croquetas (chicken was my fave) and the steak flatbread. The white sangria was great and they DO NOT put sugar in it ...which i loved. The bartender was super friendly and attentive. Would definitely go back and want to try their brunch!
Nice restaurant.Electrical outlets everywhere. Clean eclectic design.Not much on the menu that called my attention, but prices seemed ok.. Beef soup is awesome!

This place is great! Friendly staff and music that always gives me happy feet.We love the yuccas fritas, the churrasco, and all the salads, which--with added chicken or shrimp--are a complete meal for around $15.

Yum! They had so many tapas selections with a huge menu full of variety. I was pretty happy with everything I had except some of the items came out lukewarm when they should have been hot. Weird since tapas come on a flow and the place wasnt crowded. Their happy hour is also great ($5 sangria if I remember correctly).

This place is the best authentic place. Came here on a first date a year ago. Came back for our year aniversary and they treated us like we were family. Shots on shots on shots. We can't wait to come here again. Great food and even better service. Thanks for making us feel so special

My favorite place to eat and drink in the Lower East Side hands down! The staff is super nice and professional. They give you this amazing tasting shot named "Donkey Sauce," upon arrival. I recommend the "Churrasco" (Skirt steak) as your main course and my go to drink is the super tasty Sangria! As an appetizer I really enjoyed the "piggyback dates."Can't tell you enough about this place, you'd have to come and try it yourself! Tell them James sent you! :-)

This place is amazing! The food is great and the drinks are never water down. I love the waitress and bartender, music is always poppin! Def a place to meet up with friends after work and even brunch!
Great service, great food. The patatas bravas and the pinchos platter are to die for, accompany that with an ice cold caipirinha and you're good to go.

I am super skeptical about giving Marcha a review to the public, its such a hidden gem I want to keep it to myself. Now, I have come here for drinks a few times; the ambiance is great because its pretty trendy on the inside and there isn't that loud dive scene going on. If Allen is behind the bar you know your drinks will be made to perfection. Last Saturday, I came for brunch with a girlfriend after all other places in the LES were full (I kind of forgot they did brunch or this would have been my first stop). There was no wait and it was 3:30 in the afternoon...prime brunch time. You can pay and additional $15 for bottomless brunch drinks for 1.5 hours with an any entrée; which is around $11-15. Our server was a sweetheart she allowed us to try every flavor of there flavored mimosa. We sat for hours and just chatted, listened to music and were not rushed out. I believe this is what brunch is suppose to be like...not that packed, loud music and people scene. I encourage all to go and enjoy yourself!
MARCHA!!!! Is my favorite place to go just grab a good meal and great beer. All the employees here are welcoming and treat me as family. Please check it out you are sure to return.
The staff and owners are fantastic, they treat you like family and the food is deliciousI highly recommend Marcha Cocina

5 star company, 5 star food, 5 star choice! - My girlfriend and I went there on a whim because of the great reviews and lack of a wait. What a phenomenal decision. They were friendly from the moment we walked in the door and kindly showed us to our seats. We ordered beers (Ommegang) but the cocktails that people were drinking around us looked awesome as well. We ordered the friend calamari, croquettes, and a paella that was nothing shy of a work of art. Let me step back and say that I'm not generally a huge fan of seafood. Still the calamari came out first and was one of the best things I've ever tasted. The croquettes were amazing and the paella was on point. There was nothing I didn't enjoy and the price was great as well. I know this place is going to be popular once the word gets out. Would recommend.

Love this place. Great little spot for happy hour margaritas. The staff are awesome, especially Allen the bartender! Venue is light and airy. Perfect for afternoon drinks on a summer day. Highly recommend.
My friends and I came here for New Year's Eve dinner and the food was just as aromatic and delicious as I expected. Try their garlic shrimp and churrasco, with red or white sangria! Mm yes!!
Love this place. My favorite is the Croquetas!!!!!!! Must come to try the food. Service is excellent. Very attentive and quick. Awesome Mimosa as well :)
Service was excellent, very tasty sangria, the Gambas al Ajijo were amazing. Will be back, came here with a group of 11 people.!

I am all about making sure to support my fellow Latinos in the food industry! This place never disappoints. Their brunch is yummy, and their drinks..EVEN better!! Their mango mojitos are delicious and make you feel like you are on vacation. My fave dish is the Guacamole. I love guac but Marcha makes it extra special by adding pieces of fried cheese on top which are my absolute favorite!!! As a true Dominican i love my queso frito! Service is super dope and one of the reasons why me and my friends always come!! Keep up the good work Marcha!!

Marcha Cocina is absolutely an amazing place. I love coming back here. From the first time I entered I was greeted with a warm hello. They staff are very attentive and the food is absolutely delicious. I recommend the croquets plater as a starter dish. Every time I go that's the first thing I order. The drinks are so great and the beer is always fresh. The atmosphere is so great and it's in an awesome neighborhood. I look forward to coming here and bringing my friends and family. I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Came here for brunch and had the steak with eggs, and let me tell you it was great! Potatoes was well cooked and seasoned just as the steak. Nice salad that goes with the eggs. Also unlimited mimosa, can't go wrong with that. Overall very good food and very satisfied.

I finally made it to Marcha Cocina Bar and I absolutely LOVED IT!! The coconut and pineapple mojito is to die for and you will find the best salads ever! I am vegan and I was able to find great and delicious meals!! Parking is awesome too because they don't have meters!
This place was incredible. Delicious food and great service and the free shot at the end was fantastic! Shout out to Wendy who was an excellent waitress!!

Where do I begin ! It's a rarity to find a place that has excellent service, amazing food such as the guacamole with fried cheese and the steak flat bread ! The drinks are GREAT especially my fav the coconut capirinia!!! For all these reasons my friends and I will definitely continue to come back !!-Michelle R
awesome food... gambas, dates wrapped with bacon with blue cheese! wow... mojitos and shot of fireball coquito delicious...

My favorite place! Modern tapas and A fusion of Latin American food brought & introduced to lower east side.  The food is amazing! The drinks are amazing and best of all  the atmosphere is really nice ( the staff is great)Kid Friendly environment ! My favorite tapas dish is the piggyback dates, The Gambas al Ajillo, the croquetas and of course the calamari. As for the main dish I would say  the paella con  langosta, it is amazing hands down. Overall It's a chill place where you able to sit, talk and eat without feeling overwhelmed! I definitely recommend it!!

Best  I've ever had! In the dishes we tried they typically roasted something until it was wonderfully charred - tomato sauce really complimented poached eggs. Simple, fresh, and really well made. includes a stewed chickpea paste in the middle. The cups were rusty though so that was weird.

We went for a dinner party with friends to celebrate his promotion with the NYPD, but only joined them for drinks.  Mostly because it was impossible to find parking, to include a parking lot.  From what I saw the place was decent, but the space could be laid out better.  Especially the bathroom!

Have been to this great tapas restaurant a couple of times. Wonderful hospitality and very quick service. Food is great, the croquetas are my personal favorite, along with the mojitos =p this place also plays a pretty good music selection... Good vibes throughout my visits here

Initially went in for drinks and after seeing their special on quesadillas, fish tacos, wings and mini burgers I decided to go with the quesadilla which was delicious. In addition to that Mojitos were 2 for the price of 1, can't beat that. Last but not least service was great.

Yesterday I had the immense pleasure of having a late lunch at Marcha. Let me start off by saying that as soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted and escorted to our table. The establishment itself is elegantly understated and after walking in we felt as if we were at home. If you go, let the bartender make you a refreshing caipirinha, which tasted amazing after walking in from the heat. The menu was amazing but we opted to do a tapas style lunch. The food was sinfully good!! The #foodporn comes to mind after tasting the delicacies that were being brought from the kitchen. My ultimate favorite dishes were the dates wrapped in bacon and sprinkled with blue cheese followed closely by the mushroom croquettes and then the meatballs. OMG! You would think we were stuffed, but the food was light and very satisfying! All in all, I gave Marcha 5 stars but if I could give them more I would. I have to say that the service was AMAZING! We were treated like family which is one of the benefits of eating at this Latin owned business. Our servers were very food savvy and friendly. Did I mention that the food was PHENOMENAL??!!!! I am very much looking forward to going back to Marcha to try their brunch next weekend!!! Buena suerte Marcha!!! I wish you years of continued success! I left a very very very happy customer!

Definately the place to go for some amazing drinks !!! THE GUACAMOLE is my favorite , I literally order it everytime i go ...  whether its for brunch or dinner, it is nice to finally have a restaurant with true spanish flare... especially in the lower east side ..This is now our go to place for happy hour and brunch spot for sure !!  Any place with great music awesome drinks delicious food and great prices ... Im in there !!!!!

Finally!!!! a near by classy place where I can go dine and drink and have a great time! I've tried several items from the menu... from the shrimps to the meatballs ... to the patatas bravas and the shrimp/chorizo dish that I tried just last night it was unbelievable! and let's not forget those amazing scallops! My friends had the croquettes and the calamari and they were loving their dishes!The drinks are delicious and their signature Coconut Mojito!!! well let's just say....Mmmm mmmm mmmm. I can't wait to go for brunch! The service is great and the people are so nice... it makes the whole dining experience wonderful!!! This is the spot to go to!!! Thank you for coming to the LOWER EAST SIDE!!!!!!

I recently moved out of an apartment on Avenue C, but I wish Marcha Cocina was opened when I lived there! After spending the afternoon down the block, I went into Marcha Cocina for some dinner. The croquetas and flatbreads were delicious. They also have a super tasty sangria. The service was wonderful. We sat at the bar and the bartender was attentive and friendly. I'm looking forward to going back!
Calm and attractive place to have tasty food plus excellent customer service with it. Mojitos are great next to every entree on the menu.
Really good food And service. Alan and Marcelo best bartenders. I love their sangria.

Come here pretty often with friends for brunch and I'm NEVER DISAPPOINTED . The pancakes melt in your mouth.. and their unlimited FLAVORED mimosas are amazing . A staple for Sunday brunches . The food is so good my brunch ran into dinner hours and I order something to go and the food is just so flavorful. And the owner is extremely nice and welcoming.
Flavored mimosas (love the passion fruit), really tasty food, perfect for Brunch, new favorite go to spot.

Absolutely beautiful atmosphere. We sat at the bar and had a wonderful conversation with the bartender. No words will do the food justice, it is far and away the BEST tapas joint in the east village. The food was absolutely fantastic, they know what they're doing. Bottom line: unreal food, unlimited sangria, perfectly euphoric !
SO GOOD - the seared scallops and croquettes were delicious (the wild mushroom one in truffle sauce is bomb).   Come here for sure!

We had calamari as an app & it was amazing..the chorizo flatbread was delicious..would definitely go back.. The service is awesome...we never had to ask for a drink...great place to go for a girls night out..
Great place love the food excellent service warm environment and the mojitos are freaking amazing
Cool spot. Stopped here for a drink while waiting to meet friends. Super nice people and chill atmosphere.

I was very disappointed by this place. After reading great reviews about their Washington Heights restaurant, I was very excited to try their food in their east village location. The food was not what i expected. We ordered the ribeye steak (medium rare) and it was basically bloody raw. We also ordered their calamari and it was cold and unappetizing, their chorizo plate was very salty, the bread was burnt, and the mixed seafood dish was unpalatable. Overall very disappointing and will not be returning. The staff however was very nice and deserts were the only passable dishes of the night.

I must say the word excellent is an understatement for this place. Great atmosphere, great service and great food and drinks. A friend of mine took me there for a birthday and I kept going back since then! Always a good idea!

This place has the best croquetas I've ever tasted. The staff is super welcoming an friendly. Has a cozy vibe without the loud annoying music. The killer mojito are amazing. Third time here in 2weeks lol!!! P.S. I will be back...

Came here on a day off for the 1st time. Ordered the chorizo and a salad with shrimp, assuming I would need to order more. The salad was not only amazing, it was huge! The chorizo, delicious. Tried the red and white sangria- they were both great. Really nice waiter/bartender. But really they got their fifth star on behalf of my grandmother- a harsh critic at 85- who insists that it was the best chorizo (and camarones) she ever tasted and that I must come back to buy some as a side to her rice- for thanksgiving!

Food was excellent, the $12 deal for sangria+tapas was totally worth it! I was hesitant at first because I was scared the tapas portion would be too small, but it was a pretty large tapas portion and completely filled me up. 10/10 would come again!

I've been here a few times now, so it's time to review.  It seems that there is nothing bad on this menu.   I have tried most of the items and have not been disappointed.  Now on to the drinks.. There is not a better happy hour... There's a great selection to pick from.  The staff is very welcoming and always smiling.  You can never go wrong with a mojito... Tostones ( addictive ) and the meatballs!!

In the little time that Marcha has been open Ive been to this restaurant a few times. I don't like repeating restaurants but I know Marcha from uptown so I wanted to try the one on east village and they did me proud. Marcha is a restaurant that i will continue to visit not only because i love the food but their drink are to die for specially the coconut mojitos and the spicy margarita. Ive visited several restaurant on east village and nothing is like this restaurant. The look is modern, the type of music they play is for everyone. The food hummm hummm hummm. If you go I recommend the albondiga its very tasty also you can try the gambas al ajillo and pleaseeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee you cannotto Marchaand  not try their paella it takes a little long but its worth the wait.  Marcha also offers excellent service, the crew is young and full of energy.  When you visit east village or you are in the NY area make sure you visit Marcha :O).
